actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.
Committee on Finance requested executive comment from OMB, Treasury Department.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to disallow certain credits and deductions and to preclude capital gains treatment regarding the use and disposition of certain highly erodible lands and wetlands.
short_title: Cultivation of Highly Erodible Lands and Wetlands Tax Act

summary.text: Cultivation of Highly Erodible Lands and Wetlands Tax Act - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to disallow any income tax credit or deduction (including any depreciation deduction) for any amounts paid or incurred on any property used in cultivating highly erodible land or wetland owned or leased by a taxpayer for the purpose of converting such land or wetland into cropland. Sets forth specified exceptions to such disallowance. Treats as ordinary income, rather than as capital gains, a specified portion of gain realized on the sale or disposition of highly erodible land or wetland cultivated by the taxpayer for the purpose of converting such land or wetland into cropland. Sets forth specified exceptions to such treatment.

titles.title: Cultivation of Highly Erodible Lands and Wetlands Tax Act

A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to disallow certain credits and deductions and to preclude capital gains treatment regarding the use and disposition of certain highly erodible lands and wetlands.
